page.title: 07Lanoyce Nurseries
page.content: The{nursery}was established in 1966 on the outskirts of St.Dominick. It occupies 9 acres, 2 acres of which are under glass.There are 11{greenhouses}, the largest measuring 50m long by 28m wide. Production is concentrated on cut flowers for the wholesale market. Mr.Rickard, the owner, supplies his two florist shops in Plymouth plus 49 others throughout Devon and Cornwall. Strains of Alstromeria, a S.American {flower}which requires no heat and can flower all year round, are the main cash crops. Mr.Rickard needs a special licence to grow this plant and his nursery is the only one in the S.W. to grow them. He travels to{Holland}to buy the Alstromeria and equipment such as leaf strippers and bunching machines A large cold store keeps the cut flowers fresh while they await delivery.
